Aug 10 2009 	Fabulous suite upgrade from wonderful receptionist	I read this site before booking any hotel now and write reviews myself as you can see.I am a Vegas regular, and my husband has been many many more times than myself, so we know what we like.I found it very hard to get Premium Economy flights direct from Manchester, (the recession has hit the airline business and it's routes hard) so hard to book a package though co op travel to get best deal. We chose Monte Carlo as it was best out of ones we were offered. It is a cheaper hotel than many, but it was not cheap cheap, our orignal bill for flights and hotel (before the upgrade) came to just under 2500. Monte Carlo is a good hotel, there are just some problems. Firstly, when we checked in, the reception area was very very busy. We were seen to quickly by a wonderful recptionist called Daniela. We had only booked a deluxe room (basic room) with the intention of upgrading on check in. Daniela talked us through all the options and gave us an amazing deal. We chose the Monco suite, but due to the interconecting doors we realsied it was going to be far too loud, (they were partying next door at 1pm) so we went back to reception and took the upgrade 2 above that, the Rose Suite, staying in room 26 001. Great great room and location!! Right by lifts, so easy to go to the food court/ newsagent type shop/ casino/ spa/ pool. The ease of access to these basic things is a massive plus point with this hotel. Our suite was beautiful, pristine, massive whirl pool jacuzzi bath, kitchen area, 2 bathrooms, living area and gorgeous bedroom. The maid was wonderful, she came twice a day, and very trustworthy, we often left jewellery, money etc out, she never touched a thing. Tip your house keeping well at the end, they are super.We said we did not want a room by the pool. The noise is as bad as people say on this site. The worst pool area we have seen in Vegas, rows and rows on sunbeds like in Spain on a cheap package deal, not Vegas at all. No free water, dirty toilets, foul staff and the music bass is so loud the windows vibrate.People queued from 7:45 for the pool which opened at 9 just to get a space!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! How ridiculous. People were using the European trick of going and leaving towels on the beds, which staff said was ok. Not fair. We used New York New York's pool instead which is free to Monte Calo guests and fabulous for a little pool area, lovely staff, always a sun bed free, free water, clean facilities, and loads of life gurads on duty, very safe if you have kids.Also, the walls and floors in this hotel are super thin. If we did not have this suite we could not have stayed in this hotel. Contray to the myth, in Vegas you don't party all day and night unless you're 18 years old ona weekend. If you are spending lots of money and there for a week, you like to be able to relax and enjoy your room's facilities.On the last night a group from Mexico took occupancy in suite above us and were so noisy my husband called reception twice and went up there with security. Group were very appologetic, and apparently there is a 3 strikes and you're out rule when it comes to noise. The problem was the tiles floors int he kitchen area, and furniture scraping again and again, plus dancing in high heels on it. Just disrespectful and unthoughtful. If you go to Vegas to party, go to a club or hire out a suitable suite, don't take the p**s out of other people who have paid to be there and need rest.I wouldn't stay here again simply because we have favourites (The Signature and The Hotel) and would like to visit new ones that are opening. But there are many many plus points if you get the right suite. Do not get a basic room, they are tiny, and do not get a suite with an interconnecting door. Also, don't get a room facing the pool or you will regret it.Hotel 32 is opening as a boutqiue hotel on top floor of Monte Carlo, that looks really luxurious, similiar to The Hotel and The Signature.There were many great points of this hotel though, the ease of getting food and out and about are not to be taken lightly. For example we love The Sig, but it's miles to walk through into the MGM to get food. Our suite at Monte Carlo meant hopping in the lift and then back again, it was brilliant. The thing putting me off coming back is the noise. The wrong room would be torture. My illness means I need rest, and my husband plays a lot of poker and so likes to relax too, the thought of those paper thin walls is not good.We had a great holiday.

Aug 9 2009 	Great location great place to stay	From the moment we arrived at the monte carlo the first impressions were good, great location opposite the mgm grand, the hotel is smaller than most and so everything in the hotel is close to eachother, the rooms are clean, and better than we expected for what we paid. The pool was amazing, you can chill out in the pool, whilst listing to the dj on certain days we spent most our time in the lazy river rapids and was a good way of chatting to people. The hotel has a subway, starbuck, mcdonalds etc inside but the best place to eat has to be diablos mexicain on the front of the hotel.

Aug 9 2009 	Stayed here to check out the Lazy River... not bad!	Check in was a breeze, there were a few people in front of us, but not bad at all. We were in a low floored room, overlooking the valet and New York, New York. Our room was nice, nothing special, but, clean, good AC, bathroom was roomy enough. Casino was reasonable..... nothing terribly special, but good enough for a day.Poker Room Small and they didn't' have enough action for DH's taste, but comparatively, the poker room at he GN was really nice. To get a seat for 1 - 2 no limit at MC was really long, ie 30 mins and they were really pushing the no limit games.Drink service Was pretty much non existent. In two hours, I saw one CW come by the slot machine I was playing at.The Micro Brewery was closed for reno's unfortunately when we were there. The poolIt was a bit too hot (+45 degrees!) and the sun was directly on the pool through the day, so we waited until 5 to go to it. When we got to the pool entrance, they went through our bags - I suspect to see if we had any glass?They told my husband he had to leave his beer he was drinking in the garbage (he had a plastic bottle - once he showed them that, they allowed him in with his beer - no biggie, but thought it was a good reminder to you... don't bring any in your bags either or they will have you take them out - the people in front of us had to do that.)We did not go in the wave pool, but saw it briefly, didn't look too big to be honest and I don't think the waves were very large either, more what I would bring a 5 year old too it seems. The lazy river was pretty decent, again, smaller than I thought it would be, but certainly sufficient. It was PACKED! There were four areas around the loop that seemed to have fairly powerful pushes... it was not so lazy of a lazy river... we enjoyed the hell out of it, but if others were coming for a lazy float, they would have been moving way faster. I think it is too small of a river to have people on flotation devices and siting at the side in the pool with their buckets of beer, there just wasn't enough room it didn't seem.Would I stay there again? Yes, if the price was right, was nothing wrong with it, but I have enjoyed other hotels more.

Aug 9 2009 	Absolutely the worst hotel on the strip!!!	Checked in on 5th of Aug. for a three night stay. Ending up staying for just one night. First off, at check in, the front desk guy had absolutely no enthusiasm to be there. I guess we were bothering him. After getting to the room, went down to the pool area for a little fun. Went in the small and dirty lazy river/pool/jacuzzi. No frills at all. After that, we all got ready to head out to the strip. After using the shower, my wife reached for a towel only to notice that it had what appeared to be dried blood on it. The towell smelled like it was not even washed. Just flat out "GROSS"!!! My wife notified the front desk manager and all he could say was that he would have housekeeping up there and offered us two free buffets. Bulls__t!!! I then called down and talked to the front desk manager and asked for a different room. He then upgraded us to a 3rd floor suite. o.k. so far, so good!!! NOT... The suite was dirty. When we pulled up the cushion to the couch to see if it pulled out for a bed, we found a hair comb along with food crumbs and god know what else all over the sofa. Not done yet!!! The bathroom sink stopper was broken and when i went to pull it up, we found a chunk of bigfoots hair tangled around it. This time we went down to the front desk/manager to tell him that we wanted to leave tomorrow and to take off the two remaining days that we were suppose to stay. No problem, he says without even an apology regarding the problems in both rooms. Customer service at its best!!! Note, the casino smelled like rotten eggs and there was construcion going in the middle of it. The shops are closed down along with a couple of the restaurants. The hotel walls paper thin and you can hear everything. The maid knocked once on the door and opened it right away. Didnt even get a chance to get to the door!!! Thank god i was appropriately dressed at the time. Customer service is terrible!!! For the price, this is what you get. I read several reviews on here before i booked it, taking a chance that those reviews were just bogus. Not at all... This hotel needs to be renovated asap!!! We been coming to vegas for almost 13 years now, twice a year, and stayed in several other hotels on the strip and by far this is the worst one of them all!!! We are not high maintenance at all. We just was a standard room that is clean for a place to sleep at night. I guess you have to experience it for yourself, like we did. From here we went over to the Luxor. Stayed there for the two remaining days in Vegas and no complaints. Very nice for the price. You decide for yourself. Cheap deals does not necessarly mean a decent room!!!

Aug 8 2009 	Did I Mention the Windows Were Filthy?	Right. We had to request a change of room twice; the first time, we took a dekko at the windows (Strip view, mind you) and said, Good Lord, They're Filthy! Next room change, we could have melted in sweat due to the air conditioning being broken. I spoke with a manager at MC and she told me that the rooms further away from the elevators work on a "Swamp Cooling" system. What??? She finally switched us to Room 13-303 and, while this was not glam, it served its purpose. However, there was a major crack in the window and the furniture was dinged and old-looking. There was no blower in the bathroom, and the toilet flushed like the Grand Canal, only louder. I can see that others have had similar observations. On top of that, I had to have my room key reactivated three times because it "powered down". As luck would have it, the Casino, repeat Casino, was having a lovely power glitch and most of the slot machines were "Out of Service". By this time I was pulling my hair out. The Monte Carlo and its employees are a bewildered lot. I say set some TNT, do an implosion, and bring that sucker down. Let the employees escape beforehand, of course.

Aug 8 2009	Common courtesy costs nothing	Stayed 5 days at end of July 09. Checking in and out was like talking to robots, no welcoming smiles, no acknowledgements, no response to our requests for quiet room away from the building site( although we got what we asked for). They dont even look up from their computers. They should lighten up or get a job somewhere else.The hotel itself is pretty average, buffet was ok but the cafe restaurant was just awful, for both food and service, so if you like junk food, eat at the food court. The swimming pool is a joke, we were there mid week and even then it was overcrowded as it is far too small, no way can you swim there. Any 3 star and above Spanish hotel has much better pools and facilities. At weekends it must be a nightmare. On the day of our departure (Friday) we could not get a lift down and a floor janitor told us to get in a service lift. On the way down from the 29th floor, a lift maintenance man got in and we tackled him about the lift problem. He told us it was nothing to do with the lifts, but at peak times, especially at weekends the hotel is 110% booked and the lifts struggle to cope.He said it was common practice to overbook so some arriving guests are shipped off to other hotels. You also have to get in line to check out, so allow yourself plenty of time to get to the airport. Be warned! Would I stay there again, yes if the price was right, and it would have to be a lot less than the 75 dollars I paid.

Aug 7 2009 	Was comfortable	My husband and I spent three nights there at the beginning of August. We booked here because we were trying to do Vegas on as little money as possible and we received a good deal on the Monte Carlo. I thought the room was adequate. It needed some updating but it was clean. There wasn't a lot of water pressure and the shower head was so low my husband had to duck to get under it and he is only 5'10''. I thought the bed was comfortable. We overlooked the pool area - not much of a view but when you get a really low rate you really can't expect much of a view and we were ok with that. We utilized the coupons they gave us at check in and saved some money. There was a food court with a Starbucks, McDs, Sbarros, Mexican (i can't remember the name but it was good). There are also a few other restaurants in the Casino. We had the dinner buffet one night - we didn't think it was bad, it was ok (buy one get one free). We ate at Cafe' one night and I thought the small plate of filet mignon with polenta and spinach was absolutely delicious. We had a few great martinis that Fernando made us (two for one special) at Andre's. We also had b-fast at an italian cafe with a patio in NY NY also buy one get one free. This was also delicious. I even thought the free drinks in the casino were pretty good - please tip the waitresses because they only make $4 an hour and depend on your tips. There were a lot of people not tipping the waitresses. More Vegas info - If we were to go again there are a few things I would do differently. I would stay closer to the area near the Bellagio or Caesar's Palace. There are free things to see and do there that begin in the evening but we were too tired to walk (because you'll walk more than you ever think you will) over to see there. If the hotel we stayed in was closer we could have gone. The treasure island pirate show, bellagio fountains (this starts at three and it is usually just one song long so it really isn't show length), the volcano eruption at the mirage - there were things I heard were good to do from people who have already been to vegas. I would have booked the show I wanted to see before we got there. (Love by Cirque Du Soleil) LV isn't like Boston where you can get same day half price tickets for almost any show. There are a limited variety of shows that have half price tickets. We also happened to go during the week that many of the shows were on vacation. This wasn't listed on any site when I was checking on line so I would call to be sure.While walking through Planet Hollywood's casino one night we were snagged by the PH timeshare people. They told us that the presentation at 10:30 would be 90 minutes long (we knew it would end up going a little longer and we had already scheduled something else at 12:30). They told us our gifts would be free tickets to a show and b-fast. Everyone in the front lobby was nice. B-fast was pre-packaged muffins or danish (they led us to believe it was a buffett). Once we got in there it was the hard hard sell - our saleman left our table a few times to do other things and we were getting aggravated and the time was going on and on. He was actually getting rude at the end and if it wasn't for the fact we had already spent over an hour with him I would have left - free tickets or not. DON'T GO ON THE TOUR. We weren't the only ones complaining about it, we ran into people in the lobby that felt the same way we did. It isn't worth the time or aggravation if you are going to be in Vegas for a short time.The show we got the tickets for was Tina and Tony's wedding. This was hysterical and the actors really got into getting the audience involved. A buffett was included and it was pretty good. Do yourself a favor and buy the tickets to go see this. Even though the tickets said general admission they assign seats before you get in there and my husband and I both got the feeling that we were seated at the table where you could see the least of the show because they were free tickets. We took the Hoover Dam/ Lake Mead cruise and we thought this was informational and interesting. We had a great tour guide named Spencer. The times can vary on this because of the traffic and security check point.We were to Fremont St experience on the last day were were there - it was a good thing we didn't have anything else scheduled because the deuce took forever to get in and out of town. They need more busses. There were so many people that were waiting to get in that couldn't fit I thought there was going to be a riot. Walk if you can, plan what you will do on what day and take a cab if you can afford it. We were also told that Fremont st is much more fun at night so go at night if you can.

Aug 7 2009 	Great Stay	Stayed here for 6 days in Sept 08. Had a great time. The pool is fantastic with a quick lazy river, pulls you round and you can't get out as the current is strong but its real fun. Next to this is the great wave pool - good size and sooo clean. Sun loungers all round pool, also another pool near loungers with lots of Cabanas to hire. Drinks are served by pool. The only downfall was they are building a massive complex next door and they turned up the pool area music so loud to block out the building noise - you sometimes got a headache from the noise. Even the staff said the music was too loud but it was set on a timer. Very classy /elegant foyer and lots of staff on the massive reception desk. All helpful but not down to earth. Great casino and tons of food courts/restuarants to go to. Prices OK. Bedrooms very large/modern and very clean with massive bathrooms. Lighting a little dark though, no main ceiling lights. No balconies here but you could open the windows 2" for some air, if you turned off the air con.Location very good, based in middle of strip, so you can get everywhere, bus over the road to take you up/down strip. You can reach all the other hotels from here by foot but it does take a long time to walk from one hotel to the next. We did lots of walking as it took 20 minutes to get down stairs from room and out onto strip but this is nothing compared to the other grand hotels which take an hour to get down and out to the strip. We lost a stone in weight from all the walking by end of holiday!!There's lots to see and do in Vegas and we did a Colorado River trip from here.6 days was not long enough for us and we intend to go back for at least 10 days next time next year.

Aug 6 2009 	Good value but doesn't offer amenities like the mega resorts	The Monte Carlo overall was a good value. We paid next to nothing to stay there. Nice location, between New York New York and the new City Center. NYNY had a much better theme and many more restaurants. We spent more time there. If you are into gambling, the casinos weren't as congested. We had a quick checkin experience and they had a room available at 11 am. There were a lot of kids around so it's family friendly. Insttead of upscale restaurants, there was a food court with sbarro, mcdonalds, and others which is more affordable for a family. It just wasn't what we were looking for.I didn't like that there weren't as many shops and restaurants like the other resorts, but on the flipped side to that, it was nice to get out of some of the craziness of the strip. The hotel rooms need to be remodeled with flat screen TVs and duvet covers instead of bedspreads. The toiletries were fine and they even provided conditioner. A lot of hotels are cutting back on this. I didn't like that the only supplied a 1500W hair dryer. It took forever to dry my hair. No bathrobes were provided. We had a really hard time getting a seat at the pool. They had a lazy river, but you had to rent a tube. Make sure to pack one in your suitcase.

Aug 6 2009 	OK but I would stay somewhere else	The hotel was fine, we aren't very picky travelers.The room was a little substandard, as it was on a low floor which faced the loading dock. The dock had trucks backing up all night with their beeping and honking. We had already fully unpacked before we realized this problem so didn't ask to be moved. The hotel was half empty so I am not sure why they put folks in these rooms as they have to be aware of the issue. If you find yourself facing the dock, then before you unpack go ask to change rooms so you can sleep (day or night depending on how much fun you plan on having).The room itself was nice, and we got a good rate. The buffet is fairly expensive and they don't have the "all-day" deal that many of the other hotels have to make it cheaper. The selection is a lot, but in Vegas terms it was substandard... we had eaten in the Luxor and Mandalay Bay buffets and found them much better.The wave pool and lazy river are nice but they are pretty darn packed with people. The staff said the hotel was fairly empty but you couldn't move at the pool so I wouldn't want to be there when the hotel is full. Also, there are a lot of folks drinking beer in the water all day but not a lot of people getting out to go to the bathroom.... a little gross when you consider how packed it was. If you want a drink you can't flag down a waitress and have to spend the better part of an hour in a line-up at the bar.The location is right in the middle of the strip but it is not handy at all to the monorail as it is right between two stations. You walk a lot in Vegas regardless so I would suggest finding a place that has handy access to the monorail. We ended up on one end of the strip after a long day and decided to get a taxi back to the hotel... that ate up any savings we got from getting a good rate.They have a business centre but the rate for internet is crazy! Bring your laptop and find a wifi spot if you think you need to be plugged in.All in all... OK place, nothing to bring you back again rather than trying out a different hotel.

Aug 5 2009	Great Stay at Monte Carlo	I stayed at the Monte Carlo from July 30-Aug 4. Myself, 22 yr old daughter , daughter's friend and 11 yr old son.We stayed in Rom 20-205, room was very clean and adequate, we had 2 seperate rooms one for myself and 11 yr old and my daughter and her bff had their own room.Pool scene was great, 3 pools...lazy river, wave pool and a regular pool along with a nice size hot tub. Dj was at pool fri/sat/sun playing hiphop, old school r&b and some old school rock. Wave pool got a lil rowdy at times...esp after 3 or so when a lot of folks were tipsy:-).......drinks were pricey, u can buy a large drink for $16.75 keep the cup and get refills for $12. I stuck with the Orange Crush and Blue Hawaiian (frozen) very tasty.Buffet wasnt very gd, esp for breakfast went once and never went back, i hear the dinner buffet is a lot better Food court has Subway, Sbarro, Mcdonalds, a chinese spot and mexican spot ....plus Starbucks.Location was gd, but still expect to do a lot of walking....the bus is very slow due to all the hotel stops, and cab fare can get pricey.Room service was excellent...always arrived in about 20-30 minutes...My daughter gambed in the casino mostly playing slots and craps, won a lil here n there.Overall a great stay and would def. recommend and return for a future visit.

Aug 5 2009 	This hotel is just the right size for us.	How nice it is not to have to walk a mile to the pool, to get the car, to get coffee, or to get to the casino. With all of the mega hotels, I find it to time consuming to get around them. I don't know why there are so many complaints about the Monte Carlo as we travelled with a large family group and eveyone loved it. Go figure. There was the opportunity to eat fast food, moderate dining, or fine dining. The little Mexican fast food was our favorite. We enjoyed all of the pools and when we older ones got tired of the loud music at the wave pool, we just went to the quiet pool. We always were able to find chairs too. It is just a nice hotel, not ultra luxurious like some, but you can't beat it for the price. It will be our first choice the next time we go too.

Aug 4 2009 	Monte Carlo	Nice hotel at the right price. It is located a little farther down the strip, but is still a comfortable walk to see everything. The rooms were a good size. We had no trouble with noise. We didn't use the pool, but it looked ok. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Aug 3 2009 	Excellent value - will be back	We arrived at 8PM on a Sunday night and there was no line for check-in - never really saw any lines during our 5 day stay.Standard room on non-smoking floor #28 - view of pool area and City Center construction. Housekeeping was great - room very clean. Beds were comfortable. Air conditioning worked well/quiet. TV remote stopped working - replacement arrived within 20 minutes. No fridge in room but brought soft cooler bag from home and filled freezer bags with ice from machine.In all honesty, music from pool area was more noticeable than construction noise - after 8AM we could hear occasional very short airhorn blasts (approx 4 blasts between 8&10AM?) Pool area very crowded due to 110F temps - easy to find chairs in sun. 4 pools (wave, river, wading and regular) excellent for kids.Used valet - very fast & friendly, highly recommendVery nice gym - $19/day or $39 for 3 daysBusiness centre had scale to weight suitcase - $2/page to print boarding passes.Food court VERY convenient - Starbucks, McDonalds. Subway, Sbarro, Rubios, Manchu Wok and Hagen Dazs.CVS pharmacy next door and Walgreens across the street for cheap drinks/snacks/toiletries/souvenirs.We arranged late checkout (1PM) for no extra charge but then decided to extend till 6PM for 1/2 daily rate - well worth the $40.Would stay here again and would consider upgrading to Monaco Suite.

Aug 1 2009 	Good hotel... definitely worth the money.	I stayed at Monte Carlo with my parents for around $80. One thing I didn't like was that the toilet is very loud, but other than that, worth the money. Not so luxurious, but very clean for sure.

Aug 1 2009 	Very nice hotel	Monte Carlo is a nice hotel & casino. It doesn't deserve the bad reviews that have been on here lately. Our room was on the 24th floor, quiet, all the drains worked, shower worked, ac worked. Didn't spend a lot of time in the room but was comfy when we were there. Casino was nice, buffet good and brunch on Sunday was good with crab legs and numerous other good options. Good value for what you get, not the nicest place but I am not a high roller and don't expect everyone to kiss my butt just cause I am on vacation. I enjoy my time away and make the most of what I was dealt (on and off the table). Recommend for the price and just enjoy your time in Vegas and quit complaining about all the little stuff.

Jul 29 2009 	Some hits -- some misses	THere was much to like about the Monte Carlo, but some things fell too short to merit another stay. Things we liked:Great customer service. Every employee we encounetered seemed genuinely committed to making each guest's stay a pleasant one. From check-in, to the great bartenders and dealers, the staff made you feel welcome at all times. The Cafe and Diablo's were good for lunch served good food at reasonable prices. Things we didn't like: The room was basic and the hallways and elevator lobby on our floor (30th) were gross. Carpet stains, frayed and torn. Bed linens were old and the bathroon towels were thin and scratchy. The bathroom and bathtub sinks slow to drain. The pool area was not to our liking at all. Way too many kids running and screaming. The lazy river was like a parking lot. If you're looking for a basic room at a reaonable price, and a nice casino with low minimums, MC might be for you. If you're looking for a relaxing, romantic, place to stay, away from a bunch of kids, this is not the place.
Jul 29 2009 	Good value	Good value for the money, and I admit I like the size of the casino and the fact that when you come down from your room you do not have far to go for anything.

Jul 29 2009 	Maid Entered Room at 3am while I was sleeping	Imagine being sound asleep and hearing someone opening your hotel room door at 3:00 a.m. I shout "who is there" and someone says "Sorry." Yes, happened to me on Saturday at 3 a.m. at Monte Carlo. I immediately asked Front Desk to find out who entered my room. I was told a maid transposed room numbers and was putting towels into my room (the wrong room). If she knocked, I didn't hear it. I shared a room with my sister. Several times during the 3 day stay my key would not work, but her key would. Most times we were together so it wasn't a problem. One day I saw a 18 year old sitting in the hallway by my room, obviously he had the same problem with key not working and was probably waiting for his roommate to come open the door.I've been listening to my son's rap music for over 10 years so I'm used to it but not used to going on vacation and hearing it so loud you can't take a nap on the 10th floor. Our room faced pool side and they blared it so loud you couldn't rest. I like to nap in the afternoon a couple hours so I stay up late on vacation, not possible at Monte Carlo. (I might add that this is hard core rap, not the usual stuff you hear on the radio, which made it even stranger to put up with.) I am 52 and more tolerating of that stuff, but was with my 78 year old mother (in the next room) so it was very unpleasant for her.I bought a package deal thru Continental Vacations. I guess MGM has a summer ticket package where you get the air/hotel/tickets to a show. Party of 4 going. 2 rooms. Was not told until after you pay the whole price that you then go to a website where you order the show tickets. Problem is they only let you enter 2 at a time and you request your first choice, 2nd and 3rd for a show. I, of course, didn't get my 2st and 2nd, but got my 3rd choice (Lion King). When I went to enter the other 2 in our party, I put Lion King as 1st, 2nd and 3rd choice, as we all wanted to go together to the same show. Guess what??? Not available. So now 2 had to go to a show at MGM that was available and 2 had to go to Mandalay Bay for Lion King, which meant the person ordering the tickets (me) had to go to both casinos personally before the show, pick up the tickets and then the day of the show drive the other 2 to another place an hour before my show. What a hassle!! I sound like a real complainer here, don't I??? On the way home the pilot (Continental) announces we are on a new plane costing so much and requiring this amount of fuel, etc. An hour later the lady behind me starts complaining of heat blowing at her (no problem with heat in my row). When we got home and picked up our luggage, my Mom notices huge blue stains on my white shorts (on the behind). Where did that come from???? I believe the "new" plane seat! I notice someone says in a review here that they brought 50 kids to Monte Carlo and loved it. Maybe that says it all. You have to be a kid to really enjoy the place (loud rap, kids everywhere, etc.) I have been to Vegas over 12 times and this is probably the only hotel I would steer people away from. One positive is the garage is very close to the hotel, which means not much walking. Being with an older person this could be a big deal. (Although the loud rap music would negate the positive of the garage situation.)

Jul 28 2009 	Great for the money	We stayed in July. Overall it was good. I was a little nervous about a few of the reviews I read prior to going. Check in was ok but they gave us 2 doubles when we requested (by booking, email & phone) a king. They did change our room with little hassle. Room was ok. Just a room. It was clean enough to feel comfortable. Bathroom was very clean. My shower had good water pressure too. Bed was very comfy. I have stayed in worse..it reminded me of a Holiday Inn and for what I paid..that is what I got...I loved the pool area. The music was great even though it was loud. (go to quiet side if you don't like loud) DJ had a really good mix..something for everyone. I saw old people jam'n as well as young! You have to line up early if you want a seat..or go later in afternoon. Wave pool was great. Bring your own float from home. They will blow it up for you and you will save money. You can drink in all pools! Not many places let you do that!! Lazy river wasn't lazy..you will ruin a pedicure in it! But fun! Pool water was refreshing. Buffet was great for breakfast. Food court was good. Not sure about the restraunts & clubs. CVS right next door! Don't buy floats from there! Used the bus (duece) many times to get up&down strip-$7 for 24hours.Stops right outside hotel. Casino small but nice.Would stay here again for the price. Would recommend it.

Jul 28 2009 	Great Stay	I stayed there with over 50 kids, and besides the problems with the key getting reset, everything was great. Three amazing pools, 1 wave, 1 lazy river, 1 regular pool. I enjoyed it, not as flashy as the other hotels, and the shower not the best but besides that it was good. I would stay again

Jul 27 2009 	some good some not so good	OK, first let me say that the rates at the MC right now are simply unbeatable. I got a deal through Travelzoo and I think one of the nites our rate was $42.00. In addition, they threw in some spa credits and other extras. Sorry, that cannot be beat. The rooms are still nice-ish. They need to be updated. The linens are terrible. They need to replace all the towels and sheets asap, but the main facilities are still good. Pools have a good crowd but are not too crowded, even on the weekend. It's not the Ritz, but for the price we paid it was an excellent value.Here's the biggest thing...you MUST call in advance and request a room that is NOT on the pool side. Seriously. The other reviewers were not kidding. The music there is very loud and runs from 12-7pm. (For those of you that sleep late and get up to party, that might be cool, but I like a little afternoon snappy on my vegas jaunts.) I thought I would just make the request upon check in, thinking that on a Thursday the hotel wouldn't be too full. Wrong. They didn't have anything on the other side. I got some ear plugs, but even with them it was too loud to nap. Sigh. The ear plugs did block ALL of the construction noise and even blocked out security kicking out the people in the room next to us at 6am. (My husband told me about it later.)Other things went wrong during our stay. The billing was messed up. The internet cable for the laptop had to be replaced. The F&B dept is basically non-existent. Almost all the resto's are outside contractors who lease space. The hotel probably needs new/better training for a lot of their employees. Everyone was nice, but many seemed clueless. When things went wrong we would look at each other and shrug. None of it was too terrible...just not what it used to be in it's heyday.If you go there you MUST go and have 2 for 1 martini's at Andre's in the afternoon. Andre's is (another) restaurant that has leased space from the MC. It's the best deal going in vegas. Tell Dave "hey" at the door. He can set you up with the finest lemon drop you'll ever have. The food there is awesome too. We had a party of 9 and they gave us a private dining room and everything was absolutely flawless.

Jul 27 2009 	Stay at Monte Carlo 'just ok'	My husband and I stayed at the Monte Carlo from July 17-20, 2009. We arrived for check-in very early, about 9am. We did not expect our room to be ready; we were told they could check us in and give us our keys, but we would need to call back later in the afternoon to see if the room had been cleaned. The young lady checking us in was being trained at the time, so it took about 15 minutes for everything to get squared away. She didn't even speak to us the entire time, the person training her did all the talking. We asked for a room away from the construction, which the gentlemen said was not a problem. We left our bags will the Bell Desk, and were told to call them when we arrived to our room that afternoon and they would bring them up. The room was ready around 4pm, and we called for the bags, which were promptly brought up. The room was spacious, but very outdated! The bed was so old, as were all the linens, and furniture. And the walls are paper thin, you can hear everything from the rooms next door and even down the hallway. The TV kept turning off by itself and had to "warm up" before it would stay on. On the plus side, the room was very clean, including the bathroom. If you don't mind everything being old and outdated, then this is a nice property to stay at. The staff was very friendly and housekeeping did a great job. However, we would likely not stay here again.
Jul 27 2009 	Good but not great	Not much to complain about, kind of a boring hotel in terms of nightlife etc. but suitable for older travelers. Food in restaurants and buffet was good.

Jul 27 2009 	Hotel Stay was like staying in college dorm or spring break hotel	My wife and I went there at end of April 2009 for conference which was at Caesars Palace. We stayed at the Monte Carlo because it was cheaper. You certaintly get what you pay for in Vegas. Pool area had drinking games and rap music playing at high decibel levels - definitely not a family friendly environment.I did have plenty of time while wife was at conference to visit many other casinos/hotels along the strip and would recommend staying at the north end of the strip, less garbage, noise and annoying marketeers for strip clubs/escort services. Jul 26 2009 	Great Stay Will Stay There Again...	Stayed at monte carlo for 5 nights mid June 09, check was quick and smooth, we stayed in a spa suite. Spa was beside window overlooking the strip and size of room was awesome with wet bar and refrigerator. They gave us a discounted rate (std room price) for 1st night stay due to power outage between 6 & 8am, wasn't an inconveniece. Had room service for breakfast twice which was awesome and well priced. Had problem with TV cable, was fixed very quickly. Construction of town centre site was not noisy and construction is expected to be finished later in year. Had dinner at Brand Steakhouse which was good as was service, did the buffet which we used a voucher 2 for 1 offer the meal was very good with a large selection. We played tables a few times with friendly staff and nice atmosphere, our friends were staying at NY NY and they preferred MC tables and had better luck there also.Location on the strip was good, drug store next door for convenince, can catch the deuce bus for 24hrs @ $7 or taxi's are relatively cheap as well.Went to the outlet centre for cheap shopping and souvenirs (south end Las Vegas Blvd) also went through Fashion show mall which was nice but a little dearer than outlet centre. Went to souvenir shop near Sahara which wasn't as cheap as we found elsewhere, we did not manage to get to Fremont St which was recommended. Dinner at Paris in Eiffel Tower was awesome with window seats overlooking water show. Our friends got marred at Graceland Chapel which was a hoot dancing & singing (badly) with Elvis after the service. We ventured to Coyote Ugly Bar at NY NY was good although a little pretentious and attitude overdone. Hard Rock hotel was good but extremely busy was Friday night after all. Had to do grand canyon helicopter with Maverick this was spectacular and worth the expense with pilot explaining locations and attractions. So much to do and too many late nights, will definately go back and stay here again...Viva Las Vegas

Jul 26 2009 	Very good hotel	It was my first time in Las Vegas so I can't compare this hotel to the other hotels that well, but I was glad I've chosen Monte Carlo. Stayed on the 11th floor, non-smoking, king bed, pool view. Room: Huge! The largest hotel room I've ever stayed in. In-room safe. Bathroom: Huge! The largest hotel bathroom I've ever seen. Shower could be better (too low and waterjet too weak).Location: Excellent location. Five-minute walk to the MGM, 15 minutes to the Bellagio. Taxi ride from airport costs about $15. Food court: McDonalds, Starbucks, Sbarro (pizza), Hagen-Dazs, Mexican food, Subway. Service: Good in general. Fast check-in and check-out. Most employees were nice, some of them were a little rude. Casino: large casino, not as crowded as in other hotels, less cigarette smell than in other hotels. Pool: Excellent pool but can get crowded. Longchairs fill up fast.Buffet: Very good buffet, large food selection, free drinks, reasonable price. Large deserts selection. Negative aspects: If you use the complimentary luggage storage service, watch you luggage! They leave it unattended while serving other clients before they take it away. Keep an eye on your luggage until it is safely taken away. General feeling: This hotel isn't as huge as some other hotels so you can easily get from one place to the other. It doesn't really have such an obvious theme as other hotels so it feels neutral. When you spend the day visiting other hotels which are busier, it is good to get back to a more relaxed atmosphere where you feel more like home.

Jul 26 2009	Great Deal with a Great Location on the Vegas Strip	We stayed here the last week of June. Got a super deal through USAirways vacations! I have stayed at the Monte Carlo a few times in the past, but its been a few years. This time it was with my Mom and sister. We arrived early form the airport and were able to check in right away. The Monte was as beautiful and clean as I remembered it. I love the Monte Carlos location as it makes it easy to walk over to NY NY or even MGM or to the Belligio at nighttime to get a glimpse of the fountains. Our room was decent size and clean. Was shocked about how much building was being done around this hotel. I didnt like how they added the restaurant to the front since I thought it took away from the beautiful steps of Monte Carlo. The pool area was also affected. It looks like they lost some seating area due to the massive City Walk MGM project going on right now. We did enjoy the pool area everyday we stayed there. It was still very beautiful and they had a DJ in the afternoons. We went down to the pool before it opened and there was already a line! We wanted to sit by the pool that was in the shade and had the comfy chair covers. We were successful both days to get these seats. Be warned people run out at 9AM just go cover groups of chairs with towels and are gone for hours. If your going to be there all day and want a good seat in a good location get there right before 9AM. We did eat poolside at the Brew Pub, which was great. I did find out later that the Brewpub was closing. Very sad about that but curious what they will put there. We did eat at the food court every morning before we hit the pool, which was convenient. The cost saving tip Ill share is the CVS next door. This is great for snacks, water and soda. We did eat at the Buffet one night and it was just ok and would not say one of the better buffets in Vegas such as Belligio, Paris, Rio, but again it was convenient. Overall this hotel is in a great location on the Strip. Has great staff and is very clean. I would stay here again.

Jul 26 2009 	not as nice as i expected	right here we go, we stayed here from 30 june untill 7th july 09, i had previously stayed at Treasure Island 6 months before and was returning to vegas to attend the desert classic darts tournement,so i booked the monte carlo because it was nearer to the mandalay bay.Check in was ok, i did the $20 dollar trick at the desk and got up-graded to a high floor with strip view which was nice, although had to wait a few hours for the room to be cleaned, didnt mind this much as went to explore. The rooms are soooo in need of an up-date, wonky lamp shades, sheets that are not fitted and a dark feel to to the room, beds were comfy and the bathroom was clean and lots of fresh towels.The brew pub was closed as was the lance burton show (he had broken his leg??) the food court was busy in the mornings but quick service was noticed. Sharon in macdonalds never smiled once but she had a nack of getting them ques down quickly,and never once got the order wrong. Coffee was far cheaper in subway than in starbucks, and the internet accsess was $5 for 20 mins,(not bad).Diablos cantina outside was always very busy and free margharitas were given with any main meal purchased,they were also served in a very large glass insted of an egg cup which you sometimes find with "freebies". Food there was ok, i asked for more mayo and sure enough it was delivered super quick.Gift shop: Dont buy anything from here if you can help it, its $8 for a pack of cigies and $3 for a bottle of water, there is a cvs place next door where water is $1. What i found about the monte carlos location was outside were a lot of "clicky clicky men" shoving porn cards in your face and it didnt matter if you were male,female or a family, you got them, this went on all the way down to the belagio where through the walkway the street was covered in these cards, we are 35 years old and it didnt phase us, but i did see one woman try and explain it to her 6 year old!! (not good)Take your own drinks to the pool, a very skimpy waitress will come past every ten mins asking if you want drinks, we did once and it cost nearly $18 for a beer and a coke, then a tip?? Pool was great although the jacuzzie was icy cold, i saw a elderly woman in there with blue lips!! Lazy river is good fun but gets crowded by inflatables, kids pool looked quite and had a gate to stop little monsters escaping.Cafe in monte carlo was similar to Treasure Islands, almost same menu so i wasnt dissapointed, although the corned beef hash could have done with a makeover from delia smith. Try the mushroon and cheese omlette, very nice.At night coming back, the walls were thin and there was a bit of noise from the neighbours, also the trays from room service that had been left on the floor in the mornings for collection, were still there,and old pizza boxes in the hallway to trip over when youve had one too many.The casino was average, not much excitment going on, went for a craps lesson one morning and walked away as the way it was explained didnt make any sense and the dealer was far more intrested in takling about himself, there was a hour out of my life ill never get back. the drinks were free as long as you gambled,however the glasses were more of a small tumbler with far too much ice, and the waitress was rarley seen, so if your after a cheap drink, dont sit at a slot machine hoping she will come or you will find yourself putting $20 dollars in so your looking busy , just go and pay full whack for your beer , you still save money.I wouldnt stay here again, as it really needs somebody to go in and shake things up a bit, seems a bit stuck in the 70's, but a good base if your going to party,det drunk,and sleep.One word of warning,,,, when going to watch the fountains of the belagio, DONT buy water from the shop inside $8 !!!! i nearly cried when i saw a man with a ice box selling it for $1 outside the fountains.Have Fun, were going back next year but will stay in Treasure Island again.(sorry m.c)x

Jul 25 2009 	Loved the lazy river!	I've stayed at the Venetian, Golden Nugget, Planet Hollywood, Sahara, and Trump Towers and now the Monte Carlo. In comparison, the MC is a nice hotel if you're looking for a clean run of the mill room in a relatively good location that is easy to navigate at a reasonable price. Very easy access from the parking garage to the lobby, elevators, pool, and food court. Of all the hotels I've stayed in this one was definitely the most convenient to all the amenities. The front desk personnel, food servers, lifeguards, and housekeepers were all very pleasant and helpful. We were disappointed that the Brew Pub was closed, but we were happy with the Food Court. McDonald's was our favorite and it was open til 3 am and re-opened at 5 am. The prices were very reasonable .... they even offered $1 sweet tea!We absolutely loved the pool area, especially the lazy river. Instead of paying $14 or $15 to rent a tube for the day we purchased $2 tubes from Wal-Mart. The pool attendants graciously inflated the tubes for us and even offered to write our names on them. Even though the room is nothing fancy, the bed and pillows were very comfortable. The air conditioner also worked well and was very quiet.The only negative is the City Center which is being built next door. It looms over the pool area and looks so out of place. I certainly hope it is more attractive when it is completed later this year. Las Vegas Blvd. is being modified to accommodate the City Center traffic which creates a traffic jam. It also makes it more difficult to walk to the Bellagio and other casinos on that side. There use to be a tram between the MC and the Bellagio which I assume has been torn down for the City Center. We never heard any construction noises.Overall, we would definitely stay at the Monte Carlo again....it is a great hotel for the price and convenience.

Jul 23 2009 	Great value	One of my biggest complaints is the smell of the casino...it's in between pine sol and baby wipes...not great odour.pool standards have droppedrooms were good, staff were really good!

Jul 22 2009 	Great accomodations at an affordable price	For one of the older hotels on the strip it was very clean and has been nicely renovated. Unlike some of the earlier reviews we did not experience any issues with construction noise. Our check in and check out were very easy and the room was as promised in the reservations. We found it to be very convenient to have a Starbucks and a few fast food places in the hotel for early morning and late night snacks. Probably the highlight of our stay was the wonderful pool or I should say pools at the Monte Carlo. It was nice to have the option of a wave pool, a lazy river, and a regular pool to lounge in. Also the one time we ordered food while at the pool it was brought out in a timely manner and was very yummy. Just be careful when charging to your room because you could experience some sticker shock by the end of the week. Out of our whole stay the only negative thing we did find is that the room service is slow on cleaning the food trays left in the halls. The spa facilities at the hotel are well worth a visit. In specific the hot stone massage was awesome - make sure you ask for Christina.

Jul 21 2009 	Terrific service and location	I spent four nights at the Monte Carlo last month. I love going to Las Vegas, but I'm not much of a gambler. I like to relax, shop, and just hang out. This hotel is perfect for my interests. Ideal location across from MGM so it's easy to get on the monorail and travel up and down the strip. Room was clean and quiet. Air conditioner worked well and bed was very comfortable.No coffee in the room which I dislike, but seems typical for hotels on the strip. I ordered room service and had a standing order every morning at 6:30. Service was fantastic. They brought my coffee every morning on time and even poured it for me!I went to the spa and had a pedicure - seemed a little rushed, but still very enjoyable and not too expense. Overall, an excellent value!

Jul 21 2009	Monte Carlo Las Vegas	My husband, teenager and I recently vacationed for three weeks in the US (we are Canadians). We arrived in LA, stayed in Anaheim, Palm Springs and then in Vegas for the final 10 days of our vacation. This was our third visit to Vegas and each time we've stayed in different hotels. This trip we stayed at the Monte Carlo because of the three pool areas, especially the lazy river. The lazy river was what we expected but that was the only fun thing about the Monte Carlo. We arrived in our room with a view looking through windows that had not been cleaned in years. The view was overlooking an awful construction area. Not pleasant. The Monte Carlo must be a very old hotel that has never been renovated. The room we were first assigned had large chunks of wood missing from the furniture, dark stains all over the carpet, very old-style tv, and the comforters on the beds looked like they were put there in 1980, washed from time-to-time but still old. It looked like someone urined on the desk chair. The bathroom had the same overall feeling. My thought is that when you walk into a hotel room you should never feel like a million people stayed there. But that is exactly how it was. The hotel moved us twice and the third time the room was better than the first two but not by much. We had prepaid for our room for ten nights and the hotel would not give us a full refund so we stayed there. We had prepaid months before arrival and received the summer special with a buffet 2 for 1. Don't bother going to the buffet. It is terrible - nothing but pig slop. For the Monte Carlo We paid $79 some nights and during the weekend we paid $189 per night so the hotel was not cheap. As mentioned, we were in California and Vegas all total three weeks. We stayed at a Howard Johnson in Anaheim, a Holiday Inn in Palm Springs and those hotels were great. My advice to anyone is do not stay at the Monte Carlo. I won't be staying there ever again or when I return in October! I DO NOT RECOMMEND IT!

Jul 21 2009 	Great Value!	Stayed at the Monte Carlo July 12th - 15th! It was a great stay loved the pool area and the atmosphere around the pool area! Our room was a suite on the 30th floor and that was awesome also! There was a Hot tub, steamer shower, and bar area! I was amazed to see there was no flat screen in the room! The view was incredible and that alone would have me go back! The hotel is self if average it wasnt like the others we visited on the strip! Would I stay here again sure, the staff is friendly and casino mood at this hotel is always joyful!

Jul 20 2009 	Surprise Broken	I wanted to surprise my wife and her friends on their first visit to Las Vegas with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries when they first walked into their room at the Monte Carlo Hotel. I made several calls to the hotel and was told everytime that they could not have the items in the room until after they had checked in which ruins the surprise/wow factor. Even though they had reservations I was told that the rooms were not assigned until they checked in. The statement below was taken directly from the hotels web site. I guess the key phrase is "upon their arrival". Do you have a loved one, friend or a family member staying with us? Would you like to show them you are thinking about them even though you couldnt make it out this trip?We have just the thing for you. Arrange to send them a gift upon their arrival with a card and share that little something extra.Choose from our incredible list of choices, starting with strawberries and champagne to a relaxing spa basket, and we will make it happen as if you were here.

Jul 19 2009 	Overall one of the best for value.	my wife and daughter and I stayed on the first part of our weeklong stay at this hotel, as we heard good things about it and wanted to try it out. We checked in on a Sunday afternoon and found an almost deserted hotel. The recession is really taking it's toll, I guess.The check in was fast and our agent was very professional. When we checked into our room, it was apparent thatteh air conditioning was out on our floor. The room was clean, however as my picture shows, it was lacking in updated bedding and the room needed a refresh of undinged furniture and nightstand.As we were basically using the room for sleeping, it wasn't a major issue.We used the restaurants, food court, spa, pool and casino on this trip. We found the staff very accomodating. As a few of the restaurants were under construction, our options were few. Diablo's, as i've experienced before, lived up to its reputation as a great palce for drinks and people watching, and not a bad mexican themed menu to boot.The buffet was lacking quality entree items. The cafe was much better in this regard!For the money we paid, we were very happy overall.If you can overlook a tired guestroom, this is a great hotel in a great location!

Jul 18 2009 	Great Value Hotel!	Monte Carlo is an amazing hotel for the price! I stayed here on a trip with 4 other girls and we got 2 rooms. When checking in they had put us on different floors and after asking to see if there was anything closer we ended up being right across the hall from each other. The customer service was friendly and efficient during both checkin and checkout. The location is great. It's about 3/4 of the way down the strip so you're not ALL the way at the end. It's great for walking up on one side of the Strip, and turning around and walking down the other side. It's near some other major hotels such as MGM Grand and New York, New York so it's not all by itself and it does see a lot of traffic. I came down with the flu while I was in Vegas so spent quite a bit of time in the hotel room in bed, and I can safely say that they were really comfortable! We had no problems with air conditioning at all, that all worked fine and was nice to have. The bathrooms were very roomy and clean with nice granite countertops. Lots of counterspace which is great for a room full of girls getting ready. The room service staff were really nice, as when I was sick all I wanted was either some plain toast with butter and flat Gingerale, or chicken noodle soup. While this wasn't really on the room service menu, when I called them and asked they gave me a few options that they thought would be good for someone who was sick. As most room serivce (anywhere) is expensive I would try to avoid that if you're trying to watch the spending. I only went down to the pool area once and for a short time, but the girls I travelled with were able to spend a day at the pool and said that finding an open chair wasn't too difficult (as I've stayed at other hotels in Vegas which sometimes are near impossible to find an open beach chair) and they LOVED the lazy river. It's nice to be able to float around lazily in an innertube and stay cool while soaking up some sun. There were enough palm trees around to offer some shade if you wanted it as well. For a 3-star hotel and the price that comes with it, Monte Carlo felt like a 4 star hotel with great value. Out of the other hotels in it's 3-star class, I would definitely choose Monte Carlo again over any of them.

Jul 18 2009 	Great resort	My wife and I stayed here in the middle of July, 2009, and we had a great experience. The front desk staff was very accomadating and provided us with a terrific room, a Monaco suite. The room was spacious and well designed. We had no problems finding a machine to play on or a table to play at during the entire week. The pool area was very nice and the lazy river, although crowded, was relaxing. The new parking garage is a recent addition and very convenient. It is well lit and there was a security person at all times. We will be looking forward to our next trip to Vegas and plan to stay at the Monte Carlo.

Jul 17 2009 	Great Spot On the Strip!	If you want action and convenience this is the place to stay. It is a little pricey, but hey it's Vegas! The staff are very accommodating and well organised. The parking service was EXCELLENT! The pools were wonderful and the casino even has its own food court. The only things we didn't like (which are probably common in Vegas) was the Casino is very smokey and at times the room was a little noisy from the pool music and construction work. When we checked in they did give us an option of a higher floor facing the strip for an extra $20 a night. Had we of decided to take up the offer I'd probably have nothing to complain about. From reading other reviews I had mixed feeling about staying here, but I guess everyone has had differing experiences and some people are fussier than others. I'd recommend staying here!
